journal-title-group.journal-title: Nebraska Journal of Economics and Business

publisher.publisher-name: College of Business Administration of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln

title-group.article-title: The Influence of Location on Faculty Salaries at Major Universities

p.mixed-citation: D. Katz, "Faculty Salaries, Promotion, and Productivity at a Large University," American Economic Review 63 (June, 1973), pp. 469-477);

J. Koch and J. Chizman, "The Influence of Teaching and Other Factors upon Absolute Salaries and Salary Increments at Illinois State University," Journal of Economic Education 5 (Fall, 1973), pp. 27-34;
H. Tuckman, J. Gopinski, and R. Hagemann, "Faculty Skills and the Reward Structure in Academe: A Market Perspective," American Economic Review 67 (September, 1977), pp. 293-702.
R. Lucas, "Hedonic Wage Equations and Psychic Wages in the Returns to School- ing," American Economic Review 67 (September, 1977), pp. 549-550.
J. Antos and S. Rosen, "Discrimination in the Market for Public School Teach- ers," Journal of Econometrics 3 (May, 1975), pp. 123-150.
L. Wingo, "The Quality of Life: Toward a Microeconomic Definition," Urban Studies 10 (October, 1973), pp. 3-18.
S. Rosen, "Learning and Experience in the Labor Market," Journal of Human Resources 7 (Summer, 1972), pp. 320-342;
D. McFadden, "Conditional Logit Analysis of Qualitative Choice Behavior," in Paul Zarembka, ed., Frontiers in Econometrics (New York: Academic Press, 1974).
S. Rosen, "Hedonic Prices and Implicit Markets: Product Differentiation in Pure Competition," Journal of Political Economy 82 (January/February, 1974), pp. 34-55.
M. Friedman and S. Kuznets, Income from Independent Professional Practice (New York: National Bureau of Economic Re- search, 1954),
W. L. Hansen, B. A. Weisbrad, and R. P. Straus, "Modeling the Earnings and Research Productivity of Academic Economists," Journal of Political Economy 80, No. 4 (1978), pp. 729- 741.
P. Steiner, M. Eymonerie, and W. Wolf, "At the Brink: Report on the Economic Status of the Profession, 1970-71," American Association of University Professors Bulletin 57 (Summer, 1971), pp. 223-285.
K. Roose and C. Anderson, A Rating of Graduate Programs (Washington, D.C.: American Council on Education, 1970).
E. Gross and P. Grambsch, University Goals and Academic Power (Washington, D.C.: American Council on Education, 1968).
D. Brown, The Mobile Professors (Washington, D.C.: American Council on Education, 1967).
U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, Spring 1970 Cost Estimates for Urban Family Budgets (Washington, D.C.: U.S. Department of Labor, 1970).

M. Bayless, "The Differential Attractiveness of Locations and the Spatial Pattern of Wages: The Case of University Professors," (unpublished Ph.D. dissertation, Washington University, St. Louis, 1979).
"The Urban Disamenity Revisited," in L. Wingo and A. Evans, eds., Public Economics and the Quality of Life (Baltimore: The Johns Hopkins University Press, 1977).
T. Caplow and R. McGee, The Academic Marketplace (New York: Basic Books, Inc., 1960);
W. Moore, "The Relative Quality of Graduate Programs in Economics, 1958-1972: Who Published and Who Perished," Western Economic Journal 11 (March, 1973), pp. 1-23,
H. Harmon, Modern Factor Analysis (Chicago: The University of Chicago Press, 1967).
A. M. Freeman, "Air Pollution and Property Values: A Methodological Com- ment," Review of Economics and Statistics 53 (November, 1971), pp. 415-416.
G. Johnson and F. Stafford, "Lifetime Earnings in a Professional Labor Market: Academic Economists," Journal of Political Economy 82 (May/June, 1974), pp. 549-569.
